intro: Lactuca pseudosenecio, commonly known as the slender lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family (Compositae). It is characterized by its upright, slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which is typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens and as a decorative plant.
